categories.name: General disorders and administration site conditions
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

models.g1: Hemoglobin (Hgb) <LLN - 10.0 g/dL; <LLN - 6.2 mmol/L; <LLN - 100 g/L
models.g3: Hgb <8.0 g/dL; <4.9 mmol/L; <80 g/L; transfusion indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a reduction in the amount of hemoglobin in 100 ml of blood. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability.

models.term: Blood and lymphatic system disorders - Other, specify
models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

models.g1: Mildly hypocellular or <=25% reduction from normal cellularity for age
models.g2: Moderately hypocellular or >25 - <50% reduction from normal cellularity for age
models.g3: Severely hypocellular or >50 - <=75% reduction cellularity from normal for age
models.g4: Aplastic persistent for longer than 2 weeks
models.definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.

models.g2: Laboratory findings with no bleeding
models.g3: Laboratory findings and bleeding
models.definition: A disorder characterized by systemic pathological activation of blood clotting mechanisms which results in clot formation throughout the body. There is an increase in the risk of hemorrhage as the body is depleted of platelets and coagulation factors.

models.g1: >ULN and >Baseline
models.g3: Steroids initiated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of eosinophils in the blood.

models.g3: ANC <1000/mm3 with a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an ANC <1000/mm3 and a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour

models.g1: Laboratory evidence of hemolysis only (e.g., direct antiglobulin test; DAT; Coombs'; schistocytes; decreased haptoglobin)
models.g2: Evidence of hemolysis and >=2 g decrease in hemoglobin
models.g3: Transfusion or medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate widespread erythrocyte cell membrane destruction.

models.g3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a form of thrombotic microangiopathy with renal failure, hemolytic anemia, and severe thrombocytopenia.

models.g4: Clinical manifestations of leucostasis; urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of white blood cells in the blood.

models.g1: Mild pain
models.g2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in a lymph node.

models.g2: >ULN
models.g3: Requiring urgent intervention
models.definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate increased methemoglobin in the blood.

models.g3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenic purpura, fever, renal abnormalities and neurological abnormalities such as seizures, hemiplegia, and visual disturbances. It is an acute or subacute condition.

models.g1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
models.g2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
models.g3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in aortic valve function or structure.

models.g1: Periods of asystole; non-urgent medical management indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without cardiac electrical activity. Typically, this is accompanied by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation; new onset
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; embolus requiring urgent intervention
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible P waves and an irregular ventricular response due to multiple reentry circuits. The rhythm disturbance originates above the ventricles.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; embolus requiring urgent intervention
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with organized rhythmic atrial contractions with a rate of 200-300 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

models.g2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with complete failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the AV node to the ventricles.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a delay in the time required for the conduction of an electrical impulse through the atrioventricular (AV) node beyond 0.2 seconds; prolongation of the PR interval greater than 200 milliseconds.
A disorder characterized by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

models.g1: Mild pain
models.g2: Moderate pain; pain on exertion; limiting instrumental ADL; hemodynamically stable
models.g3: Pain at rest; limiting self care ADL; cardiac catheterization; new onset cardiac chest pain; unstable angina
models.definition: A disorder characterized by substernal discomfort due to insufficient myocardial oxygenation e.g., angina pectoris.
models.change: Addition: Navigational note; Clarification: Grade 2, 3, Definition

models.g1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by pathological irregularities in the cardiac conduction system.

models.g2: Present
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a bluish discoloration of the skin and/or mucous membranes.

models.g1: Asymptomatic with laboratory (e.g., BNP [B-Natriuretic Peptide ]) or cardiac imaging abnormalities
models.g2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
models.g3: Symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; hospitalization; new onset of symptoms
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the heart to pump blood at an adequate volume to meet tissue metabolic requirements, or, the ability to do so only at an elevation in the filling pressure.

models.g3: Symptomatic due to drop in ejection fraction responsive to intervention
models.g4: Refractory or poorly controlled heart failure due to drop in ejection fraction; intervention such as ventricular assist device, intravenous vasopressor support, or heart transplant indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by failure of the left ventricle to produce adequate output.

models.g1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
models.g2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
models.g3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in mitral valve function or structure.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with relatively constant PR interval prior to the block of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a progressively lengthening PR interval prior to the blocking of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

models.g2: Asymptomatic and cardiac enzymes minimally abnormal and no evidence of ischemic ECG changes
models.g3: Severe symptoms; cardiac enzymes abnormal; hemodynamically stable; ECG changes consistent with infarction
models.definition: A disorder characterized by gross necrosis of the myocardium; this is due to an interruption of blood supply to the area.

models.g2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
models.g3: Severe with symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; intervention indicated; new onset of symptoms
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the muscle tissue of the heart.

models.g1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an unpleasant sensation of irregular and/or forceful beating of the heart.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; ablation
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; incompletely controlled medically; cardioversion indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with abrupt onset and sudden termination of atrial contractions with a rate of 150-250 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

models.g2: Asymptomatic effusion size small to moderate
models.g3: Effusion with physiologic consequences
models.definition: A disorder characterized by fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.
A disorder characterized by an increase in intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardium.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, ECG or physical findings (e.g., rub) consistent with pericarditis
models.g2: Symptomatic pericarditis (e.g., chest pain)
models.g3: Pericarditis with physiologic consequences (e.g., pericardial constriction)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by irritation to the layers of the pericardium (the protective sac around the heart).

models.g1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
models.g2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
models.g3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in pulmonary valve function or structure.

models.g1: Imaging findings only
models.g2: Symptomatic without signs of heart failure
models.g3: Symptomatic heart failure or other cardiac symptoms, responsive to intervention; new onset of symptoms
models.g4: Refractory heart failure or other poorly controlled cardiac symptoms
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an inability of the ventricles to fill with blood because the myocardium (heart muscle) stiffens and loses its flexibility.

models.g1: Asymptomatic with laboratory (e.g., BNP [B-Natriuretic Peptide ]) or cardiac imaging abnormalities
models.g2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
models.g3: Severe symptoms, associated with hypoxia, right heart failure; oxygen indicated
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., ventricular assist device); heart transplant indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by impairment of right ventricular function associated with low ejection fraction and a decrease in motility of the right ventricular wall.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
models.g3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with alternating periods of bradycardia and atrial tachycardia accompanied by syncope, fatigue and dizziness.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
models.g3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate less than 60 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Urgent medical intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates above the ventricles.

models.g1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis
models.g2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
models.g3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in tricuspid valve function or structure.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia that originates in the ventricles.
A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible QRS complexes due to rapid repetitive excitation of myocardial fibers without coordinated contraction of the ventricles.

models.g2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates distal to the bundle of His.

models.term: Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify
models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

models.term: Ear and labyrinth disorders - Other, specify
models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

models.g1: Mild pain
models.g2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the ear.

models.g1: Mild pain
models.g2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the external ear region.

models.g4:
Adults: Decrease in hearing to profound bilateral loss (absolute threshold >80 dB HL at 2 kHz and above); nonservicable hearing

Pediatric: Audiologic indication for cochlear implant; > 40 dB HL (i.e., 45 dB HL or more); SNHL at 2 kHz and above
models.definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to ear structures.

models.g1: Serous otitis
models.g2: Serous otitis, medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Mastoiditis; necrosis of canal soft tissue or bone
models.definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation (physiologic response to irritation), swelling and redness to the middle ear.

models.g1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by noise in the ears, such as ringing, buzzing, roaring or clicking.

models.g1: Mild symptoms
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient (objective vertigo) or as if he himself were revolving in space (subjective vertigo).

models.g2: Symptomatic; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by dizziness, imbalance, nausea, and vision problems.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Severe symptoms; hospitalization indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by the adrenal cortex not producing enough of the hormone cortisol and in some cases, the hormone aldosterone. It may be due to a disorder of the adrenal cortex as in Addison's disease or primary adrenal insufficiency.

models.g1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Severe symptoms, medical intervention or hospitalization indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by signs and symptoms that resemble Cushing's disease or syndrome: buffalo hump obesity, striations, adiposity, hypertension, diabetes, and osteoporosis, usually due to exogenous corticosteroids.

models.g2: No breast development by age 13 yrs for females; testes volume of <3 cc or no Tanner Stage 2 development by age 14.5 yrs for males
models.g3: No breast development by age 14 yrs for females; no increase in testes volume or no Tanner Stage 2 by age 16 yrs for males; hormone replacement indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by unusually late sexual maturity.

models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

models.g2: >= +2 SD (standard deviation) above mid parental height or target height
models.definition: A disorder characterized by greater growth than expected for age.

models.g1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands. This results in hypercalcemia (abnormally high levels of calcium in the blood).

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; thyroid suppression therapy indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by excessive levels of thyroid hormone in the body. Common causes include an overactive thyroid gland or thyroid hormone overdose.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Severe symptoms; medical intervention or hospitalization indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands.

models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation and cellular infiltration of the pituitary gland.

models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of hormones from the pituitary gland.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; thyroid replacement indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of thyroid hormone by the thyroid gland.

models.g1: Physical signs of puberty with no biochemical markers for females <8 years and males <9 years
models.g2: Physical signs and biochemical markers of puberty for females <8 years and males <9 years
models.definition: A disorder characterized by unusually early development of secondary sexual features; the onset of sexual maturation begins usually before age 8 for girls and before age 9 for boys.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; mild symptoms with no intervention indicated
models.g2: Replacement therapy initiated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by low testosterone.

models.g1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by inappropriate masculinization occurring in a female or prepubertal male.

models.g1: Intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
models.g4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by visual perception of unclear or fuzzy images.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); glare symptoms affecting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
models.g4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes. This results in a decrease in visual acuity and eventual blindness if untreated.

models.g3: Corneal ulcer without perforation in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an area of epithelial tissue loss on the surface of the cornea. It is associated with inflammatory cells in the cornea and anterior chamber.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; symptoms relieved by lubricants
models.g2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
models.g3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
models.g2: Unilateral paresis without double vision
models.g3: Bilateral paresis or unilateral paresis causing double vision in peripheral gaze, but not in central gaze
models.g4: Bilateral paresis requiring head turning to see beyond central 60 degrees or double vision in central gaze
models.definition: A disorder characterized by incomplete paralysis of an extraocular muscle.

models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated; no change in vision
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL; best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately sight-threatening; limiting self care ADL; decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
models.g4: Sight-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

models.g1: Mild pain
models.g2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the eye.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; nonoperative intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Limiting self care ADL; operative intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by impaired eyelid function.

models.g1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
models.g2: Limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden or brief burst of light.

models.g1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
models.g2: Limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an individual seeing spots before their eyes. The spots are shadows of opaque cell fragments in the vitreous humor or lens.

models.g1: Less than 8 mmHg of elevated intraocular pressure (EIOP); no visual field deficit
models.g2: EIOP which can be reduced to 21 mmHg or under with topical medications and no visual field deficit
models.g3: EIOP causing visual field deficits
models.g4: Visual field deficit within the central 10 degrees of the visual field in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in pressure in the eyeball due to obstruction of the aqueous humor outflow.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
models.g3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); corneal ulcer; limiting self care ADL
models.g4: Perforation; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation to the cornea of the eye.
models.change: Addition: Grade 1, Navigational note; Clarification: Grade 2, 3, 4

models.g1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
models.g2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
models.g4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to see clearly in dim light.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
models.g2: Moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
models.g3: Marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
models.g4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the optic nerve (second cranial nerve).

models.g1: Asymptomatic; no visual field deficit
models.g2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
models.g3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
models.g4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by swelling around the optic disc.

models.g1: Soft or non-pitting
models.g2: Indurated or pitting edema; topical intervention indicated
models.g3: Edema associated with visual disturbance; increased intraocular pressure, glaucoma or retinal hemorrhage; optic neuritis; diuretics indicated; operative intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid around the orbits of the face.

models.g1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
models.g2: Limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by fear and avoidance of light.

models.g3: Macular sparing rhegmatogenous detachment
models.definition: A disorder characterized by the separation of the inner retina layers from the underlying pigment epithelium.

models.g1: No retinal detachment and treatment not indicated
models.g2: No retinal detachment and treatment indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a small laceration of the retina, this occurs when the vitreous separates from the retina. Symptoms include flashes and floaters.
models.change: Addition: Grade 1, Navigational note; Clarification: Grade 2; Deletion: Grade 3, 4

models.g2: Retinal vascular disorder without neovascularization
models.g3: Retinal vascular disorder with neovascularization
models.definition: A disorder characterized by pathological retinal blood vessels that adversely affects vision.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
models.g2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
models.g4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder involving the retina.

models.g1: No change in vision from baseline
models.g2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
models.g4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the sclera of the eye.

models.g1: Anterior uveitis with trace cells
models.g2: Anterior uveitis with 1+ or 2+ cells
models.g3: Anterior uveitis with 3+ or greater cells; intermediate posterior or pan-uveitis
models.g4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
models.definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation to the uvea of the eye.

models.g2: Moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)

models.g2:
Adult: BMD t-score < -2.5; loss of height <2 cm; therapy to improve BMD indicated; limiting instrumental ADL;

Pediatric: Low BMD (z-score <= -2.0) and significant fracture history (defined as a long bone fracture of the lower extremity, vertebral compression, 2 or more long bone fractures of the upper extremities); therapy to improve BMD indicated
models.g3:
Adult: Loss of height >=2 cm; hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL; 

Pediatric: Limiting self care ADL

models.g1: Hyperpigmentation covering <10% BSA; no psychosocial impact
models.g2: Hyperpigmentation covering >10% BSA; associated psychosocial impact
models.definition: A disorder characterized by darkening of the skin due to excessive melanin deposition.

models.g1: Hypopigmentation or depigmentation covering <10% BSA; no psychosocial impact
models.g2: Hypopigmentation or depigmentation covering >10% BSA; associated psychosocial impact
models.definition: A disorder characterized by loss of skin pigment (e.g., vitiligo).

models.g1: Mild induration, able to move skin parallel to plane (sliding) and perpendicular to skin (pinching up)
models.g2: Moderate induration, able to slide skin, unable to pinch skin; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe induration; unable to slide or pinch skin; limiting joint or orifice movement (e.g., mouth, anus); limiting self care ADL
models.g4: Generalized; associated with signs or symptoms of impaired breathing or feeding
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an area of hardness in the skin.

models.g1: Combined area of ulcers <1 cm; nonblanchable erythema of intact skin with associated warmth or edema
models.g2: Combined area of ulcers 1 - 2 cm; partial thickness skin loss involving skin or subcutaneous fat
models.g3: Combined area of ulcers >2 cm; full-thickness skin loss involving damage to or necrosis of subcutaneous tissue that may extend down to fascia
models.g4: Any size ulcer with extensive destruction, tissue necrosis, or damage to muscle, bone, or supporting structures with or without full thickness skin loss
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a circumscribed, erosive lesion on the skin.

models.g3: Skin sloughing covering <10% BSA with associated signs (e.g., erythema, purpura, epidermal detachment, and mucous membrane detachment)
models.g4: Skin sloughing covering 10 - 30% BSA with associated signs (e.g., erythema, purpura, epidermal detachment and mucous membrane detachment)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by less than 10% total body skin area separation of dermis. The syndrome is thought to be a hypersensitivity complex affecting the skin and the mucous membranes.

models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by air in the subcutaneous tissue.

models.g1: Telangiectasias covering <10% BSA
models.g2: Telangiectasias covering >=10% BSA; associated with psychosocial impact
models.definition: A disorder characterized by local dilatation of small vessels resulting in red discoloration of the skin or mucous membranes.

models.g4: Skin sloughing covering >=30% BSA with associated symptoms (e.g., erythema, purpura, or epidermal detachment)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by greater than 30% total body skin area separation of dermis. The syndrome is thought to be a hypersensitivity complex affecting the skin and the mucous membranes.

models.g1: Urticarial lesions covering <10% BSA; topical intervention indicated
models.g2: Urticarial lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA; oral intervention indicated
models.g3: Urticarial lesions covering >30% BSA; IV intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an itchy skin eruption characterized by wheals with pale interiors and well-defined red margins.

models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

models.term: Surgical and medical procedures - Other, specify
models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
Urgent intervention indicated
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; hemodynamic or neurologic instability; organ damage; loss of extremity(ies)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by occlusion of an arterial vessel by a blood clot that develops in an artery.

models.g1: Asymptomatic
models.g2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Severe symptoms; intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by leakage of intravascular fluids into the extravascular space. This syndrome is observed in patients who demonstrate a state of generalized leaky capillaries following shock syndromes, low-flow states, ischemia-reperfusion injuries, toxemias, medications, or poisoning. It can lead to generalized edema and multiple organ failure.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Symptomatic, associated with hypotension and/or tachycardia; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by episodic reddening of the skin, especially face, neck, or chest.

models.g1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Minimally invasive evacuation or aspiration indicated
models.g3: Transfusion; invasive intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a localized collection of blood, usually clotted, in an organ, space, or tissue, due to a break in the wall of a blood vessel.

models.g1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by an uncomfortable and temporary sensation of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating upon cooling.

models.g3:
Adult: Systolic BP >=160 mm Hg or diastolic BP >=100 mm Hg; medical intervention indicated; more than one drug or more intensive therapy than previously used indicated;

Pediatric and adolescent: Systolic and/or diastolic > 5 mmHg above the 99th percentile
models.g4: Adult and Pediatric: Life-threatening consequences (e.g., malignant hypertension, transient or permanent neurologic deficit, hypertensive crisis); urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a pathological increase in blood pressure.

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Medical intervention indicated; hospitalization indicated
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences and urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a blood pressure that is below the normal expected for an individual in a given environment.

models.g2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Severe symptoms; invasive intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by the loss of lymph fluid into the surrounding tissue or body cavity.

models.g1: Trace thickening or faint discoloration
models.g2: Marked discoloration; leathery skin texture; papillary formation; limiting instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
models.definition: A disorder characterized by excessive fluid collection in tissues that causes swelling.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Severe symptoms; invasive intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a cystic lesion containing lymph.

models.g2: Brief (<24 hrs) episode of ischemia managed medically and without permanent deficit
models.g3: Prolonged (>=24 hrs) or recurring symptoms and/or invasive intervention indicated
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; evidence of end organ damage; urgent operative intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by impaired circulation to an extremity.

models.g2: Present
models.definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the wall of a vein.

models.g2: Present
models.definition: A disorder characterized by a blood clot and inflammation involving a superficial vein of the extremities.

models.g1: Asymptomatic; incidental finding of SVC thrombosis
models.g2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated (e.g., anticoagulation, radiation or chemotherapy)
models.g3: Severe symptoms; multi-modality intervention indicated (e.g., anticoagulation, chemotherapy, radiation, stenting)
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent multi-modality intervention indicated (e.g., lysis, thrombectomy, surgery)
models.definition: A disorder characterized by obstruction of the blood flow in the superior vena cava. Signs and symptoms include swelling and cyanosis of the face, neck, and upper arms, cough, orthopnea and headache.

models.g1: Medical intervention not indicated (e.g., superficial thrombosis)
models.g2: Medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Urgent medical intervention indicated (e.g., pulmonary embolism or intracardiac thrombus)
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences with hemodynamic or neurologic instability
models.definition: A disorder characterized by occlusion of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.

models.g1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
models.g3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

models.g1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
models.g2: Moderate symptoms, medical intervention indicated
models.g3: Severe symptoms, medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)
models.g4: Life-threatening consequences; evidence of peripheral or visceral ischemia; urgent intervention indicated
models.definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation involving the wall of a vessel.
